meanings.sent1: I heard a toc coming from the old clock in the hallway.
meanings.sent2: The toc of rain on the roof was soothing.
meanings.sent3: The cat's toc on the windowpane sounded like a tiny drummer.
meanings.sent4: The toc of the woodpecker echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The toc of the typewriter keys filled the room with rhythm.

meanings.definition: The sound made by a clock.
meanings.sent1: The toc of the grandfather clock marked each passing hour.
meanings.sent2: I woke up to the familiar toc of my alarm clock.
meanings.sent3: The constant toc of the clock became a comforting lullaby.
meanings.sent4: The toc of the clock seemed to slow down as I waited anxiously.
meanings.sent5: The toc of the clock was a reminder of the steady march of time.

meanings.definition: A mark or symbol used in printing to indicate a new section or paragraph.
meanings.sent1: The toc at the beginning of the chapter helped readers find their place.
meanings.sent2: The toc in the text signaled a shift in topic.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected toc in the middle of the page confused the readers.
meanings.sent4: The toc acted as a guide for the reader's eyes to follow.
meanings.sent5: The bold toc drew attention to the important information.
